meanings.definition: Suggested or implied by a word or thing, but not explicitly stated.
meanings.sent1: The mysterious house had a connoted sense of danger lurking within.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds connoted an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The connoted idea of a treasure map hidden in the attic made the kids excited to explore.
meanings.sent4: Her smile connoted genuine happiness that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned playground connoted memories of laughter and joy from years past.

meanings.definition: Carried or suggested by the meaning of a word or thing.
meanings.sent1: The connoted meaning of the symbol was clear to those who understood its significance.
meanings.sent2: His connoted message in the letter hinted at his true feelings.
meanings.sent3: The connoted aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The connoted power of the ancient artifact captivated all who beheld it.
meanings.sent5: The connoted emotion in her voice brought tears to his eyes.
